TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: ti sa Pułałuyałuyan kati sa Sułałułałui (Qatsiłay village, p.180)

S.FORM: ti sa Pułałuyałuyan kati sa Sułałułałui a marevaław.
ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan kati sa Soljaljoljaljoi a marevaljaw.
S.TRANSL: There was a married couple called Pułałuyałuyan and Sułałułałui.

S.FORM: manu makeving azua ti sa Sułałułałui a pulingelingetj a kinatsavatsavan.
mano makeving azoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi a polingelingetj a kinacavacavan.
S.TRANSL: Sułałułałui had an itch all over her body,

S.FORM: qau nu kiqenetjan a semavaqavaqar anga.
qao no kiqenetjan a semavaqavaqar anga.
S.TRANSL: and was disgusting to look at.

S.FORM: qau masengats anga ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
qao masengac anga ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan was disappointed in her,

S.FORM: qau siverits anga azua ti sa Sułałułałui.
qao siveric anga azoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: and discarded her,

S.FORM: qau sa pavaliti a pakaiv ti sa Tjukutjuku.
qao sa pavaliti a pakaiv ti sa Tjokotjoko.
S.TRANSL: and changed to marry Tjukutjuku.

S.FORM: qau ka pakaiv tjai sa Tjukutjuku, maqepu a qaliqali sa zian.
qao ka pakaiv tjai sa Tjokotjoko, maqepo a qaliqali sa zian.
S.TRANSL: At his wedding to Tjukutjuku others gathered and danced.

S.FORM: qau kisan kuya ti sa Sułałułałui tu sika siverits timadju.
qao kisan koya ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi to sika siveric timadjo.
S.TRANSL: Sułałułałui was very upset because she was discarded.

S.FORM: qau semenay i pasa likuz tua likezał; "kuda tsemevud a załum tu ku pavanaw tua ku keving," aya semenay azua ti sa Sułałułałui.
qao semenay i pasa likoz toa likezalj; "koda cemevod a zaljom to ko pavanaw toa ko keving," aya semenay azoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: She chanted behind the fireplace: “May water flow out for me to wash away my itch,” she chanted.

S.FORM: mintu tsemevud a paqulid a załum.
minto cemevod a paqolid a zaljom.
S.TRANSL: Then some water did really flow out.

S.FORM: qau sipavanaw anga tua keving nimadju.
qao sipavanaw anga toa keving nimadjo.
S.TRANSL: She used it to wash away her itch.

S.FORM: mintu masualap a keving.
minto masoalap a keving.
S.TRANSL: The itch disappeared

S.FORM: qau bulabulay anga ti sa Sułałułałui.
qao bolabolay anga ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: and Sułałułałui was beautiful.

S.FORM: qau sa kialalang; qau sa vaik a sema tjua qaliqali a zemiazian.
qao sa kialalang; qao sa vaik a sema tjoa qaliqali a zemiazian.
S.TRANSL: So she dressed up and went to where the others were dancing.

S.FORM: łakua ini zian.
ljakoa ini zian.
S.TRANSL: But she didn’t dance.

S.FORM: izua i vavaw tua qinałivan a łemizałizaw sakamaya.
izoa i vavaw toa qinaljivan a ljemizaljizaw sakamaya.
S.TRANSL: She was up on the roof just looking on.

S.FORM: łakua kudain a bulay aravats; maqiłqił a qaliqali a zemiazian.
ljakoa kodain a bolay aravac; maqiljqilj a qaliqali a zemiazian.
S.TRANSL: But she was so beautiful that the others who were dancing were dazzled.

S.FORM: qau tsuay anga ini anga tezeng tua qiłqiłan a qaliqali.
qao coay anga ini anga tezeng toa qiljqiljan a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: After a time the others couldn’t stand the dazzle.

S.FORM: "aku maqiłqił itjen aravats?" aya qaliqali a zemiazian.
"ako maqiljqilj itjen aravac?" aya qaliqali a zemiazian.
S.TRANSL: “Why are we dazzled so much?” said the others who were dancing.

S.FORM: sa kiqenetji a pałevavaw.
sa kiqenetji a paljevavaw.
S.TRANSL: They looked up,

S.FORM: mintu izua ti sa Sułałułałui a naqemiladj i qinałivan, a matu qadaw a kinabulay.
minto izoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi a naqemiladj i qinaljivan, a mato qadaw a kinabolay.
S.TRANSL: and there was Sułałułałui sitting on the roof, as beautiful as the sun.

S.FORM: qau łengłengan ni sa Pułałuyałuyan.
qao ljengljengan ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: Pułałuyałuyan saw her.

S.FORM: sevisvis anga kinitjiakan a pinakaivan.
sevisvis anga kinitjiakan a pinakaivan.
S.TRANSL: He shook off the hand of the girl he was going to marry,

S.FORM: qau sa vaiki anga qemvet ti sa Sułałułałui.
qao sa vaiki anga qemvet ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: and went and embraced Sułałułałui.

S.FORM: "parepuvałavi anan," aya ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
"parepovaljavi anan," aya ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “Let’s stay married,” said Pułałuyałuyan.

S.FORM: łakua "masengats anga ken tjanusun.
ljakoa "masengac anga ken tjanoson.
S.TRANSL: But Sułałułałui said: “I don’t like you any more.

S.FORM: azua su siniverits anga ken," aya ti sa Sułałułałui.
azoa so siniveric anga ken," aya ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: You discarded me.”

S.FORM: "tsauan a makeving sun; avan ku siverits," aya ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
"caoan a makeving son; avan ko siveric," aya ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: “Yes, but you had the itch; that’s why I discarded you,” said Pułałuyałuyan.

S.FORM: łakua nuka kudain a zemenger ti sa Sułałułałui, ini anga kisalu angata.
ljakoa noka kodain a zemenger ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi, ini anga kisalo angata.
S.TRANSL: But however much he besought her Sułałułałui wouldn’t agree.

S.FORM: qau mavilad azua ti sa Sułałułałui.
qao mavilad azoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: She ran away,

S.FORM: łakua laingen ni sa Pułałuyałuyan.
ljakoa laingen ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: but he chased after her.

S.FORM: qau ini kełang anga ti sa Sułałułałui tu kemuda.
qao ini keljang anga ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi to kemoda.
S.TRANSL: She didn’t know what to do.

S.FORM: qau djemałun i gadegade, malułay anga aravats ti sa Sułałułałui.
qao djemaljon i gadegade, maloljay anga aravac ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: They got to a mountain ridge, and Sułałułałui was very tired.

S.FORM: qau "sa-u, alapu a ku łinay a ku inadjuq izua i qinałivan.
qao "sa-o, alapo a ko ljinay a ko inadjoq izoa i qinaljivan.
S.TRANSL: “Go and get my hat which I left on the roof.

S.FORM: nu mangtjez sun, parepuvałavi anga," ayain a ventsa ti sa Pułałuyałuyan.
no mangtjez son, parepovaljavi anga," ayain a venca ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: When you get back we can be married again,” she lied to Pułałuyałuyan.

S.FORM: łakua masalu ti sa Pułałuyałuyan; mintuluq a vaik a malap tua łinay.
ljakoa masalo ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan; mintoloq a vaik a malap toa ljinay.
S.TRANSL: But he gladly believed her, and went running to get the hat.

S.FORM: qau sa tsikel a sema tjua kinaizuanan ni sa Sułałułałui.
qao sa cikel a sema tjoa kinaizoanan ni sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: When he got back to where Sułałułałui had been,

S.FORM: mintu nekanga ti sa Sułałułałui.
minto nekanga ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi.
S.TRANSL: she was gone.

S.FORM: qau łevavaw tua kasiw, sa łizavi ni sa Pułałuyałuyan.
qao ljevavaw toa kasiw, sa ljizavi ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan.
S.TRANSL: He climbed a tree and had a look;

S.FORM: mintu izuanga i łavek a namavilad anga.
minto izoanga i ljavek a namavilad anga.
S.TRANSL: and there she was by the sea having run away.

S.FORM: azua ti sa Sułałułałui djemałun i łavek.
azoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi djemaljon i ljavek.
S.TRANSL: When Sułałułałui got to the sea,

S.FORM: azua ti sa Sułałułałui: "iła paru tsatsagał," aya semenay.
azoa ti sa Soljaljoljaljoi: "ilja paro cacagalj," aya semenay.
S.TRANSL: she chanted: “May I become like a spider.”

S.FORM: qau mamaw anga tua tsatsagał, kavakaven anga a łavek.
qao mamaw anga toa cacagalj, kavakaven anga a ljavek.
S.TRANSL: She became like a spider, and skated over the sea.

S.FORM: qau djemałun i tagaw izua naqemiladj.
qao djemaljon i tagaw izoa naqemiladj.
S.TRANSL: She reached the far shore and sat down.

S.FORM: łakua tjenglay aravats; vaiken a lemaing ni sa Pułałuyałuyan a sema tagaw.
ljakoa tjenglay aravac; vaiken a lemaing ni sa Poljaljoyaljoyan a sema tagaw.
S.TRANSL: But Pułałuyałuyan wanted her very much, and went and followed her to the far shore.

S.FORM: łakua mintu uzai a vaław ni sa Sułałułałui i tagaw.
ljakoa minto ozai a valjaw ni sa Soljaljoljaljoi i tagaw.
S.TRANSL: But Sułałułałui already had a husband over there.

S.FORM: qau azua ti sa Pułałuyałuyan kipatsay tu tjenglayan.
qao azoa ti sa Poljaljoyaljoyan kipacay to tjenglayan.
S.TRANSL: So Pułałuyałuyan killed himself for love.
